text: z Tall building zone F â€“ this consists of the remaining areas of the borough that are considered suitable for tall buildings. By its nature, this area is geographically diffuse, including areas with a variety of different characters from town centres through to purely residential areas. Given the existing character of these areas, while they are considered suitable for some additional height, they should not be the locations for the tallest buildings in the borough, which should be concentrated in zones A-E. 14.27 The tall buildings zones are set out in figure 10 below. Appropriate heights for the tallest points- within each zone, and appropriate heights within the site allocations, are set out in table 4 below. Further principles for the development of these different zones are set out in part 6 of the policy. 164 Tower Hamlets Local Plan BACK TO POLICIES Figure 10: Tall building zones PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES
